en.hero-desc: Fullstack developer focused on creating modern, accessible, and functional digital experiences.
en.about-text: Hello, I'm Fernanda ‚Äî a Fullstack Developer living in Israel, proudly Israeli, Portuguese, and Brazilian, and deeply connected to my Jewish roots. I speak Portuguese, Spanish, English, and Hebrew at a conversational level. My journey began in 2009, when I came to Israel as a volunteer in a nursing home for Holocaust survivors. That experience changed everything ‚Äî it strengthened my connection with my roots and was also when I met my incredible Israeli husband. Back in Brazil, I continued challenging myself personally and professionally. I earned my first degree in Culinary Arts, where I studied for 2 and a half years, and I kept studying Hebrew and always seeking to know more about my roots. In 2016, I made aliyah definitively. Since then, I built my family here and spent years raising my two children while planning my next steps. I realized that to keep up with the demands of family life and the Israeli job market, I needed to evolve. Today, I'm in the 7th semester of a Bachelor's degree in Information Systems at PUC Minas and I'm also enrolled in HackerU's Fullstack Development program. Currently, I'm enhancing my skills in front-end and back-end, AI automation, machine learning, and neural networks ‚Äî combining creativity, technology, and human touch. Israel taught me that with chutzpah, balance, and dedication, it's possible to adapt, grow, and build digital solutions that connect people and ideas anywhere.
en.service-1: Modern and fast websites that work perfectly on any device
en.service-2: Custom systems and dashboards tailored to your business
en.service-3: Secure database integration to manage your information
en.service-4: Accessible websites that are easy for everyone to use
en.project-1-subtitle:
Educational website for ‚ÄúShalom Practice‚Äù, designed to help Portuguese-speaking users learn Hebrew in a clear, progressive, and interactive way.

Tech stack: HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

Challenges: Structuring content for language learning, balancing Hebrew and Portuguese directions (RTL/LTR), and keeping the interface simple yet engaging.

Next steps: Expand content modules, add interactive exercises, and enhance accessibility and mobile performance.
en.project-2-subtitle:
Multilingual website for ‚ÄúEretz Hatikvah Tours‚Äù, a company specializing in spiritual and cultural tours in the Holy Land. The site supports Hebrew, English, and Portuguese.

Tech stack: HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

Challenges: Building an intuitive structure, ensuring responsiveness, and creating smooth multilingual navigation.

Next steps: Add user features (e.g., login), improve performance, and run usability tests.
en.project-3-subtitle:
Web platform for ‚ÄúMindEasy‚Äù, a mental health clinic management system focused on streamlining appointment scheduling and client management.

Tech stack: HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

Challenges: Creating a clean and professional UI, ensuring secure and user-friendly scheduling flows, and organizing therapist‚Äìclient data clearly.

Next steps: Integrate calendar sync, implement login/authentication, and enhance data privacy and performance.
en.project-4-subtitle:
Interactive platform for ‚ÄúGrowKid‚Äù, focused on supporting children‚Äôs early development through fun, educational, and age-appropriate activities.

Tech stack: HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

Challenges: Designing a child-friendly UI, ensuring intuitive navigation for young users, and organizing content by developmental stages.

Next steps: Add user progress tracking, include multilingual support, and optimize for tablets and mobile devices.
en.project-1: Network Infrastructure ‚Äì Network Infrastructure Management System: A project focused on managing a company's network infrastructure, including mapping departments, connected devices, and controlling IT resources across headquarters and branch offices.
en.project-2: Bibliotech ‚Äì Library Book Rental Management: A system designed for managing the rental and return of books in libraries. It enables efficient control of borrowings, reservations, and user history.
en.project-3: Neurolink ‚Äì Mental Health Clinic Appointment App: An application developed to schedule appointments at a mental health clinic. It allows patients to choose professionals, book time slots, and track their consultation history.
en.project-4: Business Intelligence ‚Äì Humanitarian NGO ‚Äì A data analysis (BI) system for a non-governmental organization, focused on identifying poverty areas, tracking donations, and managing items needed for humanitarian campaigns.
en.project-5: Cres√ßa ‚Äì Child Development Monitoring Platform: A platform for tracking child development up to 6 years old. It collects and analyzes cognitive, motor, and social data, supporting educators and guardians in monitoring children's progress.
en.project-6: PetShop Management System ‚Äì This project is a distributed system designed for managing clients, services, and grooming appointments (bathing and trimming) in pet shops. The system is intended exclusively for internal use by the staff, providing a practical and accessible solution directly via smartphone or tablet.
en.contact-text: You can also reach me through the links below or email me at rivlisnanda@gmail.com
